title: DWEAB forms new executive committee
body: The Domestic Worker Employers’ Association Bangladesh formed a new committee at a programme at the Nari Unnayan Shakti Training Centre at Banasree in Dhaka on Sunday. The programme featured two sessions, said a press release. In the first session, detailed discussions were held on the Domestic Workers’ Protection and Welfare Policy, labour laws, the responsibilities and duties of employers and domestic workers, and the role of members in establishing the rights of domestic workers. In the afternoon session, amendments to the constitution, formulation of the annual work plan, and the election of a new executive committee took place. The newly elected executive committee president is Afroja Parvin and vice-president Quazi Dilruba Jefu, secretary Nasima Haque, treasurer Mita Rahman, office secretary Shaheda Wahab and publicity secretary is Selina Khatun. The committee also elected Marzina Begum Baby as organising secretary, Advocate Jakia Anar Koli as legal secretary, Selina Begum as assistant secretary, and Samnaz, Farzana and Parvin Akter as executive members. Abul Hossain delivered remarks as adviser of the organisation at the event, which was organised with the support of Nari Unnayan Shakti.
